action.primary: Nourishes the Lungs and stops coughing
Nourishes the Spleen and Stomach and relieves pain

contraindications: Contraindicated for those with chronic diarrhea.
Use with caution for those with diarrhea or loose stools.
Use with caution for those with Dampness.
Use with caution for those with Interior Phlegm.
Use with caution for those with abdominal fullness and bloating.
Ingestion of raw honey is not recommended for infants under twelve months.

useCases: Hernia pain due to Cold with cold hands and feet.
Deficiency of Blood and Body Fluids.
Chronic cough with Blood streaked sputum.

notes: Chinese herbal pills use Feng Mi as a binder, for taste and for its moistening and tonifying properties.
Feng Mi detoxifies Rx. Aconiti Carmichaeli #{ZhiChuanWu} Chuan Wu Tou.
One source lists this herb in the Yin Tonic category.
It can be used topically for various sores and lesions.
Use 100g or more for poisoning by Rx. Aconiti #{ZhiChuanWu} Chuan Wu or Rx. Aconiti Kusnezoffii #{ZhiCaoWu} Cao Wu.
